content:
• Monday, April 23, 2012
  • MNOV

    MediciNova (NASDAQ:MNOV) says it's received a Notice of Allowance from the Australian Government...

    MediciNova (NASDAQ:MNOV) says it's received a Notice of Allowance from the Australian Government Patent Office for an application that covers the use of ibudilast for the treatment of multiple forms of chronic neuropathic pain. Ibudilast is the company's lead drug development candidate for certain neurological conditions, including progressive forms of multiple sclerosis, neuropathic pain and drug addiction. Shares +4.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:10 PM
  • STM

    More on STMicroelectronics' Q1: The chipmaker expects Q2 sales to grow 4.5%-10.5% Q/Q (consensus...

    More on STMicroelectronics' Q1: The chipmaker expects Q2 sales to grow 4.5%-10.5% Q/Q (consensus is for 8.4%). STM, which has lost share in multiple markets, also sees growth continuing in 2H, fueled by analog and MEMS chip demand. ST-Ericsson's Q1 results are also out, and they help explain today's massive restructuring plan: sales fell 35% Y/Y, and net loss rose to $312M from $234M in Q4 and $178M in Q1 '11. STM +1.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • PSX

    ConocoPhillips spinoff Phillips 66 (NYSE:PSX) will replace Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) in the...

    ConocoPhillips spinoff Phillips 66 (NYSE:PSX) will replace Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) in the S&P 500 index, with SVU moving to the S&P MidCap 400 after the close of trading April 30. The grocer's market cap is below $1.4B, "making it more representative of the mid cap market space," S&P Indices says. SVU -1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • WRB

    W.R. Berkley (NYSE:WRB): Q1 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $1.38B (+11.7% Y/Y) in-line....

    W.R. Berkley (NYSE:WRB): Q1 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $1.38B (+11.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • NFLX

    Citi's Mark Mahaney notes Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) guidance for just 200K-800K Q2 domestic...

    Citi's Mark Mahaney notes Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) guidance for just 200K-800K Q2 domestic streaming net adds (blamed on "seasonality") falls below a Street estimate of 1.2M, and makes the company's guidance for 7M 2012 net adds look dubious. Also likely weighing on investors' minds is Reed Hastings' assertion (.pdf) that Netflix's Latin and U.K./Ireland ops will need more than 8 quarters to "reach sustained profits." NFLX -16.4% AH. Earnings call starts at 6PM ET (webcast).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • TXN

    More on Texas Instruments' Q1: TI expects Q2 revenue of $3.22B-$3.48B and EPS (exc. one-time...

    More on Texas Instruments' Q1: TI expects Q2 revenue of $3.22B-$3.48B and EPS (exc. one-time charges) of $0.36-$0.44, compared with a consensus of $3.29B and $0.40. Analog sales fell only 1% Q/Q in spite of seasonality, which suggests TI is benefiting from synergies related to the National Semi acquisition. Wireless chip sales (previous) fell 48% Q/Q and 43% Y/Y - Nokia definitely played a role, but did Amazon as well? TXN +3.8% AH. (PR) (earnings call - 5:30 PM ET)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN): Q1 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $3.1B (-8% Y/Y)...

    Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN): Q1 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $3.1B (-8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • VLTR

    Volterra Semiconductor (NASDAQ:VLTR): Q1 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $42M (+23.1%...

    Volterra Semiconductor (NASDAQ:VLTR): Q1 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $42M (+23.1% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +5.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • BIG

    Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) -14.6% AH after warning it expects FQ1 U.S. same-store sales growth to be...

    Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) -14.6% AH after warning it expects FQ1 U.S. same-store sales growth to be slightly negative, worse than guidance for a 2%-4% increase, due to weak consumables and electronics sales. The closeout retailer says business softened in March and April. Canadian sales (less than 3% of revenue) are expected to be slightly above guidance. Big Lots plans to report on May 23.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • HXL

    Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q1 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $400M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $29M....

    Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q1 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $400M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $29M. Shares +4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA): Q1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.49B...

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA): Q1 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.49B (+18.4% Y/Y) misses by $150M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix's Q2 guidance: The company sees domestic streaming subs rising to just 23.6M-24.2M in...

    Netflix's Q2 guidance: The company sees domestic streaming subs rising to just 23.6M-24.2M in Q2, and international subs to just 3.45M-4M. DVD subs are seen falling to 8.95M-9.35M. Revenue of $873M-$895M is expected for Q2, below a consensus of $897.4M. EPS of -$0.10 to $0.14 is expected, above a consensus of -$0.17. NFLX -14.2% AH. (PR - PDF) (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 3 Comments
  • NFLX

    More on Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q1: The Q1 results aren't bad, but Q2 guidance is. Domestic...

    More on Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q1: The Q1 results aren't bad, but Q2 guidance is. Domestic streaming subs rose 1.7M Q/Q in Q1 to 23.4M (guidance was for 22.8M-23.6M), streaming margin up 220 bps to 13.2%. International subs rose 1.21M to 3.07M (2.5M-3.1M expected), business lost $103M. DVD subs fell 1.08M to 10.1M (1.2M-1.8M drop expected), margin fell 680 bps to 45.6%. Free cash flow was $2M. (PR - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 3 Comments
  • ALGN

    More on Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q1 beats across the board on a 29% Y/Y jump in revenue....

    More on Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q1 beats across the board on a 29% Y/Y jump in revenue. Invisalign volume was stong, with sales revenue increasing by 17% Y/Y. The company also raises Q2 guidance, now expecting to earn $0.26 - $0.28 per share on revenue of $140M - $144M. Street estimates are for an EPS of $0.24 on revenue of $136M. Shares +13% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • GRPN

    On a weak day for tech, Groupon (GRPN +6.5%) bounced strongly off its 52-week lows, thanks to an...

    On a weak day for tech, Groupon (GRPN +6.5%) bounced strongly off its 52-week lows, thanks to an upgrade to Overweight from Evercore's Ken Sena, who notes the company is now valued just slightly above Google's $6B Dec. 2010 offer. Sena also downplays the impact of Groupon's June 1 share lockup expiration, and the possibility the company will have to take a write-down on its troubled international ops.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 8 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q1 EPS of -$0.08 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $870M (+28% Y/Y) in-line....

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q1 EPS of -$0.08 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $870M (+28% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -14.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 14 Comments
  • ALGN

    Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q1 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $135M (+29% Y/Y)...

    Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Q1 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $135M (+29% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares +13.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • UAL

    United Continental (NASDAQ:UAL) says it's ended discussions with Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY -5%) and is...

    United Continental (NASDAQ:UAL) says it's ended discussions with Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY -5%) and is negotiating solely with Boeing (BA -1.3%) for a potential order of about 200 narrow-body jets. the airline had been in talks with both companies for over six months on the nearly $17B order. The move sounds logical from a maintenance standpoint, considering that 75% of UAL's fleet is already made up of BA aircraft.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • RIO

    Shares of Rio Tinto (RIO -4.2%), already weakened by today's drop in metal prices and news of a...

    Shares of Rio Tinto (RIO -4.2%), already weakened by today's drop in metal prices and news of a contraction in Chinese manufacturing, are further impacted by claims of billionaire Gina Rinehart that RIO owes royalties to her company and partner for 12 years of production at two mines in Australia.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • COL

    BE Aerospace (BEAV +2.1%) bucks the downtrend after its Q1 results topped estimates. Net profit...

    BE Aerospace (BEAV +2.1%) bucks the downtrend after its Q1 results topped estimates. Net profit jumped 37% as margins were boosted on record sales, driven by its commercial aircraft and business jet segments.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • YRCW

    Shares of YRC Worldwide (YRCW -6.4%) trade lower after the firm seeks to reduce covenants under...

    Shares of YRC Worldwide (YRCW -6.4%) trade lower after the firm seeks to reduce covenants under a credit agreement to give it more financial flexibility.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • ABB

    ABB (ABB -3.1%) responds to ongoing rumors that it's considering buying Rockwell (ROK -3.1%),...

    ABB (ABB -3.1%) responds to ongoing rumors that it's considering buying Rockwell (ROK -3.1%), saying that it's still considering acquisitions to fill gaps in their restructuring, however a potential bid for ROK is not in its plans.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy Services (BAS +3.4%) is initiated at Market Perform rating with an $18 target price...

    Basic Energy Services (BAS +3.4%) is initiated at Market Perform rating with an $18 target price at Howard Weil, which says that while Q1 results prove BAS is not entirely insulated from "various degrees of franchise contortion in addressing established and emerging oil and liquids plays," it finds BAS "with refreshingly less to do in this regard save for sticking to its roots."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • NEM

    Opponents of Newmont Mining's (NEM -2.4%) $4.8B Minas Conga copper and gold project in Peru...

    Opponents of Newmont Mining's (NEM -2.4%) $4.8B Minas Conga copper and gold project in Peru continue to reject the enterprise despite efforts by the government to decrease its impact on the environment and improve its social benefits. The government says NEM has shown a "willingness" to work with an environmental mitigation plan, but activists say it's not enough.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • CHK

    You can shear a sheep many times, but you can skin him only once. The actions of Chesapeake's...

    You can shear a sheep many times, but you can skin him only once. The actions of Chesapeake's (CHK +3.3%) Aubrey McClendon aren't Enron-esque, but the actions - and CHK's legalese reaction - are remarkable in their tone-deafness, Kid Dynamite writes. CHK needs to understand that shareholders feel they may be getting sheared, and may react by bailing before they get skinned.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 20 Comments
  • PFCB

    Shares of the The Cheesecake Factory ([[CAKE] +1.9%) shoot higher on above-average trading...

    Shares of the The Cheesecake Factory ([[CAKE] +1.9%) shoot higher on above-average trading volume with the firm's Q1 report slated for release on Wednesday. A number of restaurants names are getting a little lift from sales numbers out from Brinker International tipping off that Chipotle and Panera's death grip on investment dollars in the sector could lighten up a bit. Gainers: PFCB +0.9%, TXRH +1.2%, DAVE +1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • DHI

    DR Horton's (NYSE:DHI) FQ2 earnings beat expectations - with the home builer's net profit...

    DR Horton's (NYSE:DHI) FQ2 earnings beat expectations - with the home builer's net profit jumping 46% to $40.6M - CEO Don Tomnitz proclaims the spring selling season to be in "full swing," and backlog rose 25% to $1.1B, yet shares are -2.3% having been up sharply earlier. But then it's a down day for a lot of stocks out there today.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • LLIT

    Microcap Dehaier Medical (DHRM) sky-rockets 36% after it inks a three-year deal to be Timesco of...

    Microcap Dehaier Medical (DHRM) sky-rockets 36% after it inks a three-year deal to be Timesco of London's exclusive Chinese distributor of its Optima series of laryngoscopes, which are used for tracheal intubations.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • HLX

    Helix Energy Solutions (HLX +8.1%) is among today's top percentage gainers in basic materials...

    Helix Energy Solutions (HLX +8.1%) is among today's top percentage gainers in basic materials stocks after the company reported better-than-expected Q1 results. HLX's profit more than doubled on increased revenues in its contracting services unit and strong prices it received on Gulf Coast crude oil sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +9.9%) spikes higher after hedge fund Jana Partners discloses holding an...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +9.9%) spikes higher after hedge fund Jana Partners discloses holding an 11.5% stake in the retailer.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • X

    U.S. Steel (X -2.2%) and AK Steel (AKS -3%) are both slated to report earnings tomorrow, and...

    U.S. Steel (X -2.2%) and AK Steel (AKS -3%) are both slated to report earnings tomorrow, and their numbers could shed some light on prospects for the sector, as well as the overall global economy this year. Analysts are expecting both companies to reverse heavy losses versus the year ago period, having languished for months after crashing hard last year on slack demand and weak pricing power.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • EAT

    Shares of Brinker International (NYSE:EAT) rip a 8.8% gain after the firm's FQ3 report shows...

    Shares of Brinker International (NYSE:EAT) rip a 8.8% gain after the firm's FQ3 report shows that Chili's and Maggiano's are starting to hold serve after seeing Panera and Chipotle grab market share over the last couple of years. The two chains were able to clock comparable-restaurant sales gains even after raising prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • LNDC

    Landec (LNDC +4.2%) shares pop after the developer of polymer products for the food and...

    Landec (LNDC +4.2%) shares pop after the developer of polymer products for the food and agriculture industries announces the acquisition of GreenLine Foods for $63M in cash with no assumed debt. The company increases revenue guidance to reflect the acquisition.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca's (AZN -1.8%) purchase of Ardea Biosciences (RDEA +51.5%) may be the first in a...

    AstraZeneca's (AZN -1.8%) purchase of Ardea Biosciences (RDEA +51.5%) may be the first in a series of deals for the company. The drug developer is considering buying other late-stage assets outside its research and development focus on cancer, diabetes and gastrointestinal ailments, in an effort to counter looming generic competition.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • BKNG

    Shares of Priceline (PCLN -2.2%) dip below the $700 mark for the first time in a month, as a...

    Shares of Priceline (PCLN -2.2%) dip below the $700 mark for the first time in a month, as a price target increase from Credit Suisse's Stephen Ju doesn't do much to alleviate selling pressure. The analyst raises up his PT on PCLN to $811 from $790.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • CFN

    CareFusion (CFN -2%) sells its neurodiagnostic business, Nicolet, to Natus Medical (BABY +2.9%)...

    CareFusion (CFN -2%) sells its neurodiagnostic business, Nicolet, to Natus Medical (BABY +2.9%) for around $58M in an all cash deal. The sale is part of CFN's ongoing effort to control costs and streamline its businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • TNC

    Tennant (TNC -9.7%) slips after Q1 results missed Street estimates due to lower sales. The...

    Tennant (TNC -9.7%) slips after Q1 results missed Street estimates due to lower sales. The company attributes the decline primarily to poor order timing and increased tightening of credit in Europe .

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • K

    With stocks retreating sharply in the U.S. and Europe on bad news from Kellogg (K -5%) and...

    With stocks retreating sharply in the U.S. and Europe on bad news from Kellogg (K -5%) and bribery allegations at Wal-Mart (WMT -4.6%), depressing eurozone PMI, and political uncertainty in Holland and France, the Vix fear index makes a comeback, surging 15.8% to 20.19.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • JOY

    Baird is out defending Joy Global (JOY -3.8%) this morning, saying that earnings are at an...

    Baird is out defending Joy Global (JOY -3.8%) this morning, saying that earnings are at an "inflection point" and poised for a recovery. Its outlook for H2 is looking better, and SGA reductions, vertical integration of its automotive division, and a reversal of weather efficiencies will help boost performance into the next year. The firm reiterates its Outperform rating on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • STI

    SunTrust (STI +3.1%) moves higher in a red tape following its Q1 earnings beat. Net interest...

    SunTrust (STI +3.1%) moves higher in a red tape following its Q1 earnings beat. Net interest margin increased 3 bps from Q4 to 3.49%. Average loans +3% Q/Q. Annualized net charge-off ratio declines 19 bps Q/Q to 1.38%. Nonperforming loans down 9%. Loan loss allowance down a hair to $2.3B, or 1.92% of all loans. Tier 1 common ratio of 9.3%. (PR) (presentation)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -4.7%), up last week after Kaleil Isaza Tuzman resigned as chairman, is...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -4.7%), up last week after Kaleil Isaza Tuzman resigned as chairman, is underperforming after announcing it's acquiring Hyro Limited, an Australia-based IT services firm, for $14.5M in stock. KIT says Hyro, which it expects will bolster its ability to support Asia-Pac customers, generated 2011 revenue of $20M, and will be immediately accretive to the company's results.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • ABB

    ABB (ABB -4.25%) may use acquisitions to "fill blank spots in automation and industrial control...

    ABB (ABB -4.25%) may use acquisitions to "fill blank spots in automation and industrial control technology," although it's not interested in buying Rockwell (ROK -3.3%) despite the speculation that occurs from time to time, ABB CEO Joe Hogan tells Germany's Handelsblatt newspaper.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • SVU

    Supervalue (SVU +0.3%) sits as one of the few service stocks peeking its head out into positive...

    Supervalue (SVU +0.3%) sits as one of the few service stocks peeking its head out into positive territory after Jefferies raises up its price target to $8 from $6.50. Analysts with Jefferies see FY13 EPS coming in at $1.26 a share and FY14 at $1.34.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • HTWR

    HeartWare (HTWR +5.5%) beating strongly after the FDA says the firm's blood pump appears to aid...

    HeartWare (HTWR +5.5%) beating strongly after the FDA says the firm's blood pump appears to aid patients with severe heart failure. However, the agency raises safety concerns about clotting rates and stroke, and says the clinical trials may have missing data and are difficult to compare. An FDA advisory panel is due to vote on the device on Wednesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (ZAGG -4.5%) sells off on heavy volume after Jim Cramer tags the stock a Sell after shares...

    Zagg (ZAGG -4.5%) sells off on heavy volume after Jim Cramer tags the stock a Sell after shares piled up a 49.7% YTD run.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 5 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -7.1%) is cut to Sell with a $9 price target at Maxim Group, which believes...

    First Solar (FSLR -7.1%) is cut to Sell with a $9 price target at Maxim Group, which believes the bull case for the stock "now rests solely on hope not reality." The firm had been optimistic about potential upside from new utility scale projects in emerging markets, but "capacity closures, competitive c-Si pricing, and performance degradation problems in high heat" now limit upside.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • WMT

    Wal-Mart's (WMT -4.1%) Mexican subsidiary, Walmex (OTCQX:WMMVY -15.8%) plummets in early trade...

    Wal-Mart's (WMT -4.1%) Mexican subsidiary, Walmex (OTCQX:WMMVY -15.8%) plummets in early trade in wake of the bribery story. Wal-Mart owns 69% of Walmex and it accounts for about 8% of company's overall profit. Walmex controls about 62% of the Mexican food retail market with EPS growth this year expected around 39%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS -6.5%) sells off on a downgrade to Hold from BWS Financial. The firm is displeased...

    Rambus (RMBS -6.5%) sells off on a downgrade to Hold from BWS Financial. The firm is displeased with the chip technology developer's flat revenue growth, which is attributed to royalty rate discounts, and thinks shares could tread water for the next 2-3 quarters as the company works on broadening its licensing stream. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM

  • Market preview: Stocks look set to follow Europe and open lower, where weak economic figures and...

    Market preview: Stocks look set to follow Europe and open lower, where weak economic figures and rising political uncertainty (I, II) are dampening the mood. S&P Benchmark futures -1%. At home, Kellog (-6.1%) is going all soggy after an earnings warning, while Wal-Mart is -4.6% following bribery allegations. Later: Netflix, Texas Instrument earnings
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CHKP

    Check Point Software (NASDAQ:CHKP) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for Q2 revenue of...

    Check Point Software (NASDAQ:CHKP) guides on its Q1 earnings call (webcast) for Q2 revenue of $324M-$336M and EPS of $0.74-0.77, compared with Street estimates of $333.7M and $0.76. Shares -5.6% premarket. Rival FTNT -2.2%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • RDEA

    Premarket gainers: RDEA +51%. CEDC +20%. KERX +16%. AMLN +12%. PLX +5%.Losers: ACHN -14%. ING...

    Premarket gainers: RDEA +51%. CEDC +20%. KERX +16%. AMLN +12%. PLX +5%.
    Losers: ACHN -14%. ING -7%. CHKP -6%. MT -5%. MT -5%. DB -5%. WMT -5%. AKS -4%. RIO -4%. FSLR -4%. BAC -4%. EPI -4%. TOT -3%. ERIC -3%. NG -3%. FCX -3%. TEF -3%. F -3%. CS -3%. MS -3%. X -3%. RVBD -3%. AMD -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • KNL

    Shares of Knoll (NYSE:KNL) dip 6.6% premarket after the furniture maker misses with its Q1...

    Shares of Knoll (NYSE:KNL) dip 6.6% premarket after the furniture maker misses with its Q1 earnings report. The company says lowered levels of government sales combined with reduced purchases from a financial services client hit its top-line.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) reports that it met primary efficacy points with top-line...

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) reports that it met primary efficacy points with top-line results from a Phase 3 study of Zerenex for hyposphatemia conducted in Japan with its partner. Shares +16.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • SPLS

    Shares of Staples (NASDAQ:SPLS) look undervalued to analysts with investors selling off the...

    Shares of Staples (NASDAQ:SPLS) look undervalued to analysts with investors selling off the perceived brick-and-mortar operation in favor of e-commerce names - despite the firm's impressive $11B in Internet sales that reps over 40% of its revenue. SPLS is down 38% over the last 5 years compared to Amazon's +200% run.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • JAKK

    JAKKS Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) agrees to repurchase $80M in stock at a price of at least $20 a pop...

    JAKKS Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK) agrees to repurchase $80M in stock at a price of at least $20 a pop and increase the size of its board as it negotiates with large shareholders gearing up for a proxy fight. Shares +5.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme (KKD) signs a development agreement with a Russian-owned company to build 40 Krispy...

    Krispy Kreme (KKD) signs a development agreement with a Russian-owned company to build 40 Krispy Kreme shops in Moscow over the next 5 years. Shares +1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM | 2 Comments
  • COP

    ConocoPhillips (NYSE:COP): Q1 EPS of $2.02 misses by $0.04. Shares -2.4% premarket. (PR)

    ConocoPhillips (NYSE:COP): Q1 EPS of $2.02 misses by $0.04. Shares -2.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
  • WMT

    Use the Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) bribery news and reflexive selloff as an "enhanced" buying...

    Use the Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) bribery news and reflexive selloff as an "enhanced" buying opportunity, says Citigroup (reported by CNBC's John Melloy). Shares -3.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
